intro: Sloanea hyptoides, commonly known as the rock fig, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Sloanea hyptoides is often found growing on rocky slopes or in disturbed soils, adapting well to harsh environmental conditions. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
